newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Wharf says debt/asset ratio 16.7 pct.
newsitem.headline: Wharf says debt/asset ratio 16.7 pct.

text.p: Wharf (Holdings) Ltd said on Wednesday that despite the loss of rental earnings while its new development, Gateway II, was being constructed, and the need to finance further developments, it had maintained a debt to asset ratio of about 16.7 percent.
The company earlier declared a 56.6 percent decline in first half net to HK$1.30 billion, although earnings per share before exceptional items gains increased 12 percent.
The company had enjoyed an unusually large one-off exceptional gain of HK$1.95 billion in the first half of 1995 from the sale of its holdings in Singapore-listed Marco Polo Developments Ltd.
Rental reversions and lease renewals in the first half 1996 at its Times Square commercial development in Hong Kong's busy Causeway Bay district, had been strong, the company said in a statement.
Occupancy levels remain at 100 percent and rentals were rising despite a retail recession.
The company's property division had foregone more than HK$200 million in rental revenues from properties razed to make way for its Gateway II development in Kowloon.
